name: Moldgraf Monstrosity
text:
Trample
When Moldgraf Monstrosity dies, exile it, then return two creature cards at random from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: The border between life and death is as thin as a layer of topsoil.

name: Moldgraf Scavenger
text: Delirium — Moldgraf Scavenger gets +3/+0 as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"When I was a child, we worried about picking the wrong mushrooms for the cook pot. Now we must worry about being picked ourselves."
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Mold Shambler
text:
Kicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Mold Shambler enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target noncreature permanent.

editions.flavor: When civilization encroaches on nature, Zendikar encroaches back.
When civilization encroaches on nature, Zendikar encroaches back.
When civilization encroaches on nature, Zendikar encroaches back.

name: Mole Worms
text:
You may choose not to untap Mole Worms during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target land. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Mole Worms remains tapped.

name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

editions.flavor: "My mind is the spread of the canopy. My heart is the embrace of the roots. I am deathless Llanowar, its fury and its peace."
"My mind is the spread of the canopy. My heart is the embrace of the roots. I am deathless Llanowar, its fury and its peace."
"The world calls and I answer."

name: Molten Birth
text: Create two 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens. Then flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Molten Birth to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Few can coax the creatures within the magma to be cooled and take form."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Molten Disaster
text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
If Molten Disaster was kicked, it has split second. (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Molten Disaster deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

name: Molten Firebird
text:
Flying
When Molten Firebird dies, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step and you skip your next draw step.
{4}{R}: Exile Molten Firebird.

name: Molten Frame
text:
Destroy target artifact creature.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: The metal filigree in his body glowed red-hot, and his flesh soon followed.

name: Molten Hydra
text:
{1}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Molten Hydra.
{T}, Remove all +1/+1 counters from Molten Hydra: Molten Hydra deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of +1/+1 counters removed this way.

editions.flavor: Keep off the glass. —Hydra warning sign

name: Molten Influence
text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller has Molten Influence deal 4 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor: Lavamancers make simple requests: obey or die.

name: Molten Nursery
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Whenever you cast a colorless spell, Molten Nursery deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: "Some detours just aren't worth it."—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

name: Molten Primordial
text:
Haste
When Molten Primordial enters the battlefield, for each opponent, gain control of up to one target creature that player controls until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.

name: Molten Psyche
text:
Each player shuffles the cards from his or her hand into his or her library, then draws that many cards.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, Molten Psyche deals damage to each opponent equal to the number of cards that player has drawn this turn.

name: Molten Rain
text: Destroy target land. If that land was nonbasic, Molten Rain deals 2 damage to the land's controller.

editions.flavor: It came as a cruel answer to the farmers' prayers.
When the molten rains fall, entire landscapes melt and flow away in rivulets of fire.

name: Molten Ravager
text: {R}: Molten Ravager gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Only the foolhardy would venture into the Akoum Mountains without a lullmage to tame the raging rocks and living fires."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House

name: Molten Sentry
text: As Molten Sentry enters the battlefield, flip a coin. If the coin comes up heads, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 5/2 creature with haste. If it comes up tails, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 2/5 creature with defender.

editions.flavor: Some take after their father, Stone, some after their mother, Fire.

name: Molten Slagheap
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Molten Slagheap.
{1}, Remove X storage counters from Molten Slagheap: Add X mana in any combination of {B} and/or {R} to your mana pool.

name: Moltensteel Dragon
text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Flying
{R/P}: Moltensteel Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: An apocalypse in dragon form.

name: Molten-Tail Masticore
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Molten-Tail Masticore unless you discard a card.
{4}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Molten-Tail Masticore deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
{2}: Regenerate Molten-Tail Masticore.

name: Molten Vortex
text: {R}, Discard a land card: Molten Vortex deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: If you can't take the heat . . . well, that's going to be a problem.

name: Molting Harpy
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Molting Harpy unless you pay {2}.

editions.flavor: Shed harpy feathers leave painful wounds—which explains the harpies' mood.

name: Molting Skin
text: Return Molting Skin to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor: "We have learned much from the orochi."

name: Molting Snakeskin
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has "{2}{B}: Regenerate this creature."

editions.flavor: Flesh wounds are meaningless to those who discard their flesh so readily.

name: Momentary Blink
text:
Exile target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
Flashback {3}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Moment of Heroism
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: "My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."
"My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."
"My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."

name: Moment of Silence
text: Target player skips his or her next combat phase this turn.

editions.flavor: The silence commemorates not those who've died, but those about to.

name: Momentous Fall
text:
As an additional cost to cast Momentous Fall, sacrifice a creature.
You draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then you gain life equal to its toughness.

editions.flavor: It wasn't long until the elves had developed a use for every part of the Eldrazi.

name: Moment's Peace
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Flashback {2}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Momentum
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a growth counter on Momentum.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each growth counter on Momentum.

name: Momir Vig, Simic Visionary
text:
Whenever you cast a green creature spell, you may search your library for a creature card and reveal it. If you do, shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
Whenever you cast a blue creature spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put that card into your hand.

name: Momir Vig, Simic Visionary Avatar
text: {X}, Discard a card: Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature card with converted mana cost X chosen at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.

editions.flavor: DIS Participation Avatar

name: Monastery Flock
text:
Defender, flying
Morph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor:
"The arrow strikes one bird down, but the flock remains."
—Jeskai teaching

name: Monastery Loremaster
text:
Megamorph {5}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Monastery Loremaster is turned face up, return target noncreature, nonland card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Monastery Mentor
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, create a 1/1 white Monk creature token with prowess.

editions.flavor: "Speak little. Do much."

name: Monastery Siege
text:
As Monastery Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans — At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card, then discard a card.
• Dragons — Spells your opponents cast that target you or a permanent you control cost {2} more to cast.

name: Monastery Swiftspear
text:
Haste
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: The calligraphy of combat is written with strokes of sudden blood.

name: Mondronen Shaman
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mondronen Shaman.

editions.flavor: "Tovolar, my master. Gather the howlpack, for the Hunter's Moon is nigh and Thraben's walls grow weak."
"Tovolar, my master. Gather the howlpack, for the Hunter's Moon is nigh and Thraben's walls grow weak."

name: Mongrel Pack
text: When Mongrel Pack dies during combat, create four 1/1 green Hound creature tokens.

name: Moniker Mage
text:
{U}, Say your middle name: Moniker Mage can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.
{U}, Say an opponent's middle name: Moniker Mage gains flying until end of turn.

name: Monkey Cage
text: When a creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Monkey Cage and create X 2/2 green Monkey creature tokens, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.

name: Monkey Monkey Monkey
text:
As Monkey Monkey Monkey comes into play, choose a letter.
Monkey Monkey Monkey gets +1/+1 for each nonland permanent whose name begins with the chosen letter.

editions.flavor: Many matches make more madcap monkey mayhem.

name: Monk Idealist
text: When Monk Idealist enters the battlefield, return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: "Belief is the strongest mortar."
"Belief is the strongest mortar."
"Belief is the strongest mortar."

name: Monk Realist
text: When Monk Realist enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.

editions.flavor: "We plant the seeds of doubt to harvest the crop of wisdom."
"We plant the seeds of doubt to harvest the crop of wisdom."

name: Monomania
text: Target player chooses a card in his or her hand and discards the rest.

editions.flavor:
"What do vermin cling to when all hope is lost?"
—Sorin Markov

name: Monsoon
text: At the beginning of each player's end step, tap all untapped Islands that player controls and Monsoon deals X damage to the player, where X is the number of Islands tapped this way.

editions.flavor:
"No one in her right mind would venture off the coast of Kjeldor during this season."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his Raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his Raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.
Just because they have a club doesn't mean they're organized.

name: Mons's Goblin Waiters
text: Sacrifice a creature or land: Add {hr} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
Poached Rukh Eggs
Rock
Cooked Rock
Unicorn-on-the-Cob
Wormfang Turtle Soup

name: Monstrify
text:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: Gackt came to regret keeping his pet toads on his head.

name: Monstrous Carabid
text:
Monstrous Carabid attacks each turn if able.
Cycling {B/R} ({B/R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: What happens when a plane of predators collides with four planes of prey?

name: Monstrous Growth
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.
Some cats are born fighters; others need a little persuading.
Get in touch with your inner monster.

The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.

name: Monstrous Hound
text:
Monstrous Hound can't attack unless you control more lands than defending player.
Monstrous Hound can't block unless you control more lands than attacking player.

editions.flavor: "Stay."
"Stay."

name: Monstrous Onslaught
text: Monstrous Onslaught deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control as you cast Monstrous Onslaught.

editions.flavor:
"Regards from Peema."
—Rishkar

name: Moonbow Illusionist
text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

name: Moonglove Changeling
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{B}: Moonglove Changeling gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)

name: Moonglove Extract
text: Sacrifice Moonglove Extract: Moonglove Extract deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
editions.flavor: Diluted, moonglove can etch living tissue. Concentrated, a drop will kill a giant.
Diluted, moonglove can etch living tissue. Concentrated, a drop will kill a giant.
Diluted, moonglove can etch living tissue. Concentrated, a drop will kill a giant.

name: Moonglove Winnower
text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.
Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.

name: Moon Heron
text: Flying

editions.flavor: The heron is the symbol of the archangel Avacyn. The fact that such spirits still fly gives the church hope that its founder may one day return.

name: Moonhold
text: Target player can't play land cards this turn if {R} was spent to cast Moonhold and can't play creature cards this turn if {W} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {R}{W} was spent.)

name: Moonlace
text: Target spell or permanent becomes colorless.

editions.flavor: Once a vision of constancy in the sky, the moon had long been hidden from view by the haze that chokes the heavens. The very sight of it had become a sign that change was in the air.

name: Moonlight Bargain
text: Look at the top five cards of your library. For each card, put that card into your graveyard unless you pay 2 life. Then put the rest into your hand.

editions.flavor: At every fifth full moon, the Moon Market convenes to peddle Ravnica's most forbidden wares.

name: Moonlight Geist
text:
Flying
{3}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Moonlight Geist this turn.

editions.flavor: Wails and whispers are the only weapons she has left.

name: Moonlight Hunt
text: Choose target creature you don't control. Each creature you control that's a Wolf or a Werewolf deals damage equal to its power to that creature.

editions.flavor: Courage alone won't keep you alive.

name: Moonlit Strider
text:
Sacrifice Moonlit Strider: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Moonlit Wake
text: Whenever a creature dies, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"As long as Rushwood glows, no life is ever truly lost."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

name: Moonmist
text: Transform all Humans. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures other than Werewolves and Wolves. (Only double-faced cards can be transformed.)

name: Moonring Island
text:
({T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.)
Moonring Island enters the battlefield tapped.
{U}, {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. Activate this ability only if you control two or more blue permanents.

name: Moonring Mirror
text:
Whenever you draw a card, exile the top card of your library face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile all cards from your hand face down. If you do, put all other cards you own exiled with Moonring Mirror into your hand.

name: Moonrise Intruder
text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Moonrise Intruder.

name: Moonscarred Werewolf
text:
Vigilance
{T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Moonscarred Werewolf.

editions.flavor: ". . . and I will bring the fury of the wild back to my village."

Moon Sprite
text: Flying

name: Moonveil Dragon
text:
Flying
{R}: Each creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Their hearts beat, their lungs draw breath, and they have one true form. I count them as allies of the living."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Moonwing Moth
text:
Flying
{W}: Moonwing Moth gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Night wings sprinkled with dust
Of a thousand soldiers dead
And a thousand cities fallen."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Moor Fiend
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor:
"Let them close the gates of Krov from dusk until dawn if they so choose. It matters not. My fiends shall yet rend their flesh from their bones."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Moorish Cavalry
text: Trample

editions.flavor: Members of the elite Moorish Cavalry are very particular about their mounts, choosing only those whose bloodlines have been pure for generations.
Members of the elite Moorish Cavalry are very particular about their mounts, choosing only those whose bloodlines have been pure for generations.
Members of the elite Moorish Cavalry are very particular about their mounts, choosing only those whose bloodlines have been pure for generations.

name: Moorland Drifter
text: Delirium — Moorland Drifter has flying as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: It has no apparent purpose or direction. It simply drifts, buoyed by breezes both tangible and otherworldly.

name: Moorland Haunt
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{W}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

name: Moorland Inquisitor
text: {2}{W}: Moorland Inquisitor gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Inquisitors are taught scripture, philosophy, and the fine art of sharpening an axe.
Inquisitors are taught scripture, philosophy, and the fine art of sharpening an axe.

name: Morale
text: Attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan." —Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars

"After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan."
—Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars

name: Morality Shift
text: Exchange your graveyard and library. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: The mind sings, though at times it sings a dirge.

name: Moratorium Stone
text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target card from a graveyard.
{2}{W}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Moratorium Stone: Exile target nonland card from a graveyard, all other cards from graveyards with the same name as that card, and all permanents with that name.

name: Morbid Bloom
text: Exile target creature card from a graveyard, then create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is the exiled card's toughness.

editions.flavor:
"From the damned I make my garden."
—Jorshu of Clan Nel Toth

name: Morbid Curiosity
text:
As an additional cost to cast Morbid Curiosity, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Draw cards equal to the converted mana cost of the sacrificed permanent.

editions.flavor: "Every creation carries a piece of its creators. Their knowledge, their dreams, their soul. That is the best part."

name: Morbid Hunger
text:
Morbid Hunger deals 3 damage to target creature or player. You gain 3 life.
Flashback {7}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Morbid Plunder
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Even the dead are raw materials for the Phyrexian vision of perfection.

name: Mordant Dragon
text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Mordant Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Whenever Mordant Dragon deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal that much damage to target creature that player controls.

name: Morgue Burst
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. Morgue Burst deals damage to target creature or player equal to the power of the card returned this way.

editions.flavor:
"Let him in. He's on the list."
—Olrich, Rakdos club owner

name: Morgue Theft
text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {4}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Morgue Thrull
text: Sacrifice Morgue Thrull: Put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: It's so hard to find good help these days.

name: Morgue Toad
text: Sacrifice Morgue Toad: Add {U}{R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"The toads of Urborg aren't fast, powerful, or pleasant, but they have their uses."
—Ertai

editions.flavor:
"The toads of Urborg aren't fast, powerful, or pleasant, but they have their uses."
—Ertai

name: Morinfen
text:
Flying
Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

editions.flavor:
"I looked into its eyes, and its soul was so empty I saw no reflection, no light there."
—Crovax

name: Morinfen Avatar
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life for each permanent you control.

editions.flavor: WL Prize Avatar

"The Moriok are fools. They try so hard to gain my favor. All I want is for them to die quickly, to join the ranks of the nim."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

name: Moriok Replica
text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Moriok Replica: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

editions.flavor: All the secrets of the Moriok with only a trace of their corruption.

name: Moriok Rigger
text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Moriok Rigger.

editions.flavor: The Moriok scavenge for weapons, for armor, for food—and ultimately for their souls.

name: Moriok Scavenger
text: When Moriok Scavenger enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Many go to Mephidross in search of lost riches. Most end up as part of the cache.

name: Morkrut Banshee
text: Morbid — When Morkrut Banshee enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Let go your grudges, or risk wandering the bogs forever in a murderous rage."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn

name: Morkrut Necropod
text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever Morkrut Necropod attacks or blocks, sacrifice another creature or land.

editions.flavor:
"There's not enough salt in all of Nephalia to wither that thing."
—Ghoulcaller Enslow

name: Morningtide
text: Exile all cards from all graveyards.

editions.flavor:
"The spirits of the righteous shall rise into the sky. Even dirtwalkers will fly like aven."
—Major Teroh
